thread.title: HS FOOTBALL: Scranton Prep remains at No. 1; Big matchups this week
thread.title_full: HS FOOTBALL: Scranton Prep remains at No. 1; Big matchups this week

author: JOBY FAWCETT / STAFF WRITER
title: HS FOOTBALL: Scranton Prep remains at No. 1; Big matchups this week
text:
Sign Up Text Alerts | newsletter 
Scranton Prep keeps rolling along, and there will be some important games this week. 
After a convincing win over Wallenpaupack, which has been a ranked team since the preseason, Scranton Prep strengthened its hold of the No. 1 spot in The Times-Tribune High School Football Poll. 
By defeating the Buckhorns by 28 points, the Cavaliers earned an additional first-place vote and garnered 86 total points to stay just ahead of Scranton, which did not play because of the teachers strike. 
Scranton continued to receive strong consideration for No. 1, earning four first-place votes despite not playing for a second straight week. The Knightsâ€™ last win came against Scranton Prep. They are scheduled to play at North Pocono on Friday. 
Dunmore is anchored in at No. 3 with 73 points. The Bucks won their fifth straight game since an opening night loss to Scranton Prep. 
This week, the Bucks will host Lakeland, which moved up two spots to No. 8 after a 53-13 win over Montrose. 
Dunmore and Lakeland have a storied rivalry. The Bucks have won 23 of the 43 meetings and the teams have combined for 12 District 2 championships in their history. 
Delaware Valley has gotten its season straightened out after starting 0-2. The Warriors, who are 
No. 4, have won four straight and will host No. 5 Valley View on Saturday at 4 p.m. as part of Warrior Day. 
Valley View captured the second annual RailRiders Bowl with a 14-13 win over Abington Heights, which stayed at No. 7 in the poll and will play at Scranton Prep on 
Saturday. 
Old Forge recorded its 21st straight win in the LFC Division III and its second straight shutout of the season with a win over Mid Valley. The Blue Devils will be home against Lackawanna Trail on Friday. 
Wallenpaupack stayed in the poll, dropping one spot to No. 9, while West Scranton fell one spot after not playing Scranton because of the teachers strike. 
Those two teams are scheduled to play this weekend. 
North Pocono and Riverside also received consideration.
